column4: ok thanks and does anyone know of a oss program i can use to attach attachments to a pdf file?
you mean, you want a PDF editor?
pdf file created via openoffice? why not just add what you want to the ODF?
btw, what do you want to attach? by "attach", do you mean "inline"?
the thing is i attached the files with a freeware program in windows - adobe reader see's them but okular does not - by attach I mean attach the file like you would attach a file to a email
were you able to get the attached stuff? I see no reason to attach a file to a PDF
yeah but only adobe acrobat reader can see and open them. okular supports embedded files but does not see them
i can't include the images in the pdf as the resolution will make them unreadable on some screens
so you want the raw image files in (unspecified format)
if you can't include the images in the PDF, you can't really use PDF
nope they are jpegs
i dont think you understand what I am trying to do
you have a bunch of images. you're trying to add them to a PDF
right?
yeah - i can add them in the actual pdf but thats going to mess up the resolution, thats why i want them as attachments to the pdf rather
why not just archive the pdf with the images?
you mean like put them all into a zip file?
or are you giving the paperwork to someone who has no conception of "directory" or "archive"
yes
yes thats a concern as well, hr people here are really thick
so it absolutely has to be PDF?
and a single file?
if it has to be viewed by acrobat, well then it has to be PDF. so you are saying that PDF has attachments? Besides just embedded images?
